Issues.Title: refactor(core): undecorated-classes-with-di migration should ignore referenced resources
Issues.Body:
Currently the undecorated-classes-with-di migration leverages NGC in order
to work with metadata resolution. Since NGC by default tries to resolve referenced
resources on initialization of the underlying TS program, it can result in unexpected
migration failures due to missing resource files.

This is especially an issue since the CLI wraps the `AngularCompilerProgram` with
special logic (i.e. to support SCSS preprocessing etc.). We don't have all of this since
we instantiate a vanilla NGC program.

The solution to the problem is to simply treat resource requests as valid, and returning
a fake content. The migration is not dependent on templates or stylesheets.. so it's the
simplest and most robust solution.

Fixes #32826 

Note: happy to update the commit message to `fix`, but I'm not sure if we want to list in the changelog. The migration is not officially running yet, and it would rather confuse people in the changelog I guess.

Issues.Title: docs(forms): expand e-mail validation description
Issues.Body:
Previously, there was no documentation of what `Validators.email()` expects as a valid e-mail address, making it difficult for people to determine whether it covers their requirements or not. Even more so that the used pattern slightly deviates from the [WHATWG version](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/input.html#valid-e-mail-address). One's only option was to look at the source code and try to decipher the regexp pattern.

This PR adds a high-level description of the validator and mentions its similarity to and differences from the WHATWG version. It also adds a brief explanation of the regexp's behavior and references for more information in the source code to provide more context to maintainers/users trying to understand the implementation in the future.

Finally, this PR also refactors `EMAIL_REGEXP (without changing its behavior) to make it more closely match the format of WHATWG version, so that it is easier for people to compare it against the WHATWG one and understand the differences.

Fixes #18985, fixes #25186, closes #32747.

Issues.Title: ci: fix dev-infra incorrectly matching all ".bzl" files as codeowner
Issues.Body:
The `dev-infra-framework` codeowners section is located after
all the codeowner sections for the individual framework packages.

This means that for certain wildcards, like `*.bzl`, dev-infra takes precedence
over the individual package sections (like of `/packages/bazel/**`). This can be
observed in the following PR where `dev-infra` got requested for file changes to
`@angular/bazel`. PR #32955.

To fix this, we move the `dev-infra-framework` section before all
individual framework package sections. This means that we only match
files which are not matched by other patterns below.

Additionally a pattern for `*.BAZEL` has been added to the dev-infra
section. This helps getting changes to `BUILD.bazel` files through
easier as dev-infra can review those (Note: only for bazel files which
are not matched by other patterns).

Issues.Title: Replace `instanceof Array` with `Array.isArray()`
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
Looking at the source code at least `compiler`, `core`, and `forms`.


### Is this a regression?

I don't think so.


### Description

Angular code is using `instanceof Array` in several occasions which is `false` for array literals in a [Node VM context](https://nodejs.org/api/vm.html#vm_vm_executing_javascript). There `[] instanceof Array` will be `false`. That causes erratic behavior in Angular Universal/SSR when run in such a VM. One example in dependency injection (see exception below).

In https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/3425 and https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/11593 Node developers recommend to always use `Array.isArray()` instead of `instanceof Array`.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

```sh
git clone git@github.com:fluidsonic/angular-instanceof-array.git
cd angular-instanceof-array
npm install
npm run build:ssr && npm run serve:ssr
```

## üî• Exception

### Description
We have made changes to the "standard" Angular project config (tsconfig.json -> tsconfig.app.json for example) throughout the evolution of the CLI. Due to the power of `angular.json`, old projects keep working, but don't look like newer projects.

#### Feature Description

When selecting text within a CDK virtual scroll, it would be nice to keep items from being removed if they are currently within the selection (i.e. if items within the `Selection.anchorNode` and `Selection.focusNode` don't get paged out).

#### Use Case

Consider a virtual scroll with 100 items showing items 1-10. The user clicks and drags a selection to item 50 and then copies the selected text. If any of the items leave the CDK scroll buffer during this operation, the clipboard only contains the text for the items currently being shown in the buffer. This results in an unexpected experience for the user, who can scroll up and still see that the items appear to be visible in the scroll region.

1. Create a list of `cdkDrag` items in a `cdkDropList` container.
2. Add to each item, a directive that has a `@HostListener` for `'dragenter'` and `'dragleave'` events.
3. Drag the items around, the host listeners do not fire when one item is dragged over another.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Native drag events should fire.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
Native drag events do not fire.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.8
- CDK/Material: 8.2.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

#### What I'm Really Trying to Do

I want to make my own version of placeholders on top of the drag/drop api. I'm working on an app where the draggable items can take up most of the screen width, so we just want to show a line (in css just a border on whichever item as necessary, not an actual element) as a placeholder, that moves to the left side of an item if the user hovers over the left half and vice versa for the right. I'd like to use the dragenter/dragleave events to know when to apply the placeholder class to a certain item, because otherwise I pretty much have to calculate which item is being hovered based on the mouse position relative to the items in the drop list.

Issues.Title: Allow to insert a chip anywhere in the list (not always at the end)
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Nowadays you can only add chip to the end of your list. You can navigate with your keyboard but only to select them and eventually delete them. You can't place your cursor between two chips and add one in place. You also can't edit an existing chip. 

Thus if you have a list of four chips and want to replace the second one, you have to delete the last three chips, add your new one and re-add chips number 3 and 4.

And finally you can't cut paste a chip to change its position.

To say it shortly chips are not manageable like a piece of text in an input text. Thus they are quite monolithic and rigid today.

#### Use Case

In my case I want to use chips with autocompletion. People can choose an existing tag or add a new one but I want them to be able to change things without having to delete everything and restart ; meaning I want to be able to:

- insert a new chip with autocompletion wherever I want by placing my cursor anywhere (via keyboard arrows)
- cut paste chips to change order ; 
- reorder chips (via drag-and-drop)
- edit chips by double clicking it (with a custom function allowing you to decide if a chip is editable)

The idea behind this is to be able to compose a sentence with some parts (chips) picked from existing content (autocompletion) and others added dynamically on the moment.

Issues.Title: [drag-drop] Memory Leak: DragRef _resizeSubscription - failing to unsubscribe
Issues.Body:
After fighting a memory leak in my app (involving dynamically generating/removing CDK drag-drop items - and those removed items still lingering around in memory) for longer than I'd like to admit, I finally figured out the memory leak only occurs when the `cdkDrag` items contain a `cdkDragBoundary` property.

This bug was introduced in release 8.2.0 (#16874) when `_resizeSubscription` was added.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387905/65986152-4f929080-e451-11e9-887f-a7b0a148442b.png)

All the subscriptions in the screenshot above are being unsubscribed in the `dragRef._removeSubscriptions()` method **except** for the `_resizeSubscription`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387905/65986387-c16ada00-e451-11e9-9462-5d91b04e10ea.png)

As a result, the `_resizeSubscription` is not closed within the `dragRef.dispose()` method.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387905/65985958-e6ab1880-e450-11e9-9d5f-57355cf0587e.png)

Simply adding `this._resizeSubscription.unsubscribe();` to the `dragRef._removeSubscriptions()` method appears to fix the problem.

I just double checked and the memory leak I am experiencing does not occur on CDK v8.1.4.


#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material: 8.2.0+
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[drag-drop] Memory Leak: DragRef _resizeSubscription - failing to unsubscribe" (#17255)

Issues.Title: perf(ripple): avoid page layouts from ripple elements
Issues.Body:
A while ago we removed the `transform` from the `.mat-ripple` element in order to avoid creating extra layers for elements that the user isn't interacting with. As a result the ripple elements can cause layouts to be triggered on the entire page, which is noticeable on larger pages (see #17252).

These changes are a hybrid solution where we add the `transform`, but only if the `.mat-ripple` element has content. This isn't bulletproof since the `:empty` selector can be invalidated by whitespace. For now this is our best solution that works across browsers, until the `contain` property gets better support.

Fixes #17252.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ripple): avoid page layouts from ripple elements" (#17253)
